sentence: The big, ugly bill slashed funding for Medicaid and SNAP, which  families in our community rely on to keep their kids healthy and fed.
title: School Funding Slashed

sentence: They passed the big, ugly bill, which slashed tax incentives for  clean energy and made electricity more expensive for everyone.
title: State Planning for Reliability and Affordability Act

sentence: It turns out their  big, beautiful bill is really a big, ugly bill.
title: One Big, Beautiful Bill

sentence: Is it because my Republican colleagues are too consumed with enacting  massive tax breaks for their billionaire donors, which is what the one  big, ugly bill was all about, but have zero interest in lifting up the  quality of life of hardworking American taxpayers, including, but not  limited to, the men and women of our Federal workforce?
title: Protect America's Workforce Act

sentence: Their  big, ugly bill, which was passed in July, already is projected to crush  working families with higher costs, and now their spending bill adds  insult to injury by slashing home improvement weatherization savings.
title: Energy and Water Development and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2026

sentence: It is not just the cost of healthcare  that is going up, but our hospitals, clinics, and providers who are  struggling to make sure that they can stay afloat, especially after the  big, ugly bill gutted and promised to take $1.5 trillion out of the  public healthcare system.
title: District of Columbia Cash Bail Reform Act of 2025

sentence: At the same time, that is on top of the costs imposed by  Republicans' big beautiful or ugly bill.
title: Unlocking Our Domestic Lng Potential Act of 2025

sentence: My Republican colleagues may be fooled by the one big, ugly bill, but  the American people are not.
title: Providing for Consideration of Senate Amendment to H.R. One Big Beautiful Bill Act

sentence: First of all, the big, ugly bill that  Republicans passed in July to provide tax breaks to the wealthy and  well-connected took away tax credits to keep cleaner, cheaper energy  producing across America.
title: Reliable Power Act

sentence: We know the impact of the big, ugly bill was to raise healthcare  costs and to raise energy bills.
title: Guaranteeing Reliability Through the Interconnection of Dispatchable Power Act

sentence: While the news is inundated with reports of Trump's airstrikes, there  are many concerns that we are not hearing about here at home: hostages;  Ukraine; Federal institutions, like USAID and NIH, gutted; the big,  ugly bill that would slash Medicaid for 14 million Americans, including  110,000 of my constituents; and the cruel cuts at SAMHSA that will  jeopardize the lives of those struggling with addiction and mental  health.
title: Trump Leads with Smoke and Mirrors

sentence: Speaker, look at your big, ugly bill.
title: Providing for Consideration of H.R. Lower Health Care Premiums for All Americans Act; Providing for Consideration of H.R. Do No Harm in Medicaid Act; Providing for Consideration of H.R. sentence: During the--I call it the big, ugly bill, we  put millions of Americans at risk of losing their health insurance  through cuts to Medicaid.
title: Medical Bills Are Too High

sentence: Add to that the Medicaid cuts in the big,  ugly bill and the end of the ACA tax credits, the strain and  uncertainty is challenging.
title: Preserving Rural Healthcare Access is Literally Life and Death

sentence: Yet, somehow, we are waiting for a Senate bill, this big, ugly bill,  as if it couldn't get any uglier, that would actually slash more  resources from the very same people that sent us here instead of making  their life better.
title: Holding Power Accountable

sentence: As the demographics of the  industrialized world start to functionally get really ugly, and we are  having to provide services, the amount of savings is starting to be  chewed up.
title: Republican Budget

sentence: The next time we get someone here saying that we need more money for  our hospitals, outpatient surgeries, and hospice care, point out to  them that, in 7 years, there is an ugly cut coming.
title: Stop Bathing in Folklore and Start Bathing in Math

sentence: Free societies do not fear words and thoughts, even those that are  hateful, ugly, evil, or obscene, because the same freedom that protects  these darkest  impulses of our nature also protects the right of men and women of good  will to confront them, expose them, and reject them.
title: Beating Heart of Democracy is Freedom of Speech

sentence: They have done everything from describing this as not the Big  Beautiful Bill but as the ``Big Ugly Bill'' and claiming that somehow  it benefits only a fraction of the American people at the top 1 percent  and accusing us of fiscal irresponsibility, while they claim that  somehow the most vulnerable among us have become even more vulnerable.
title: One Big Beautiful Bill Act

sentence: It is up to all of us to fight back, to educate our youth, and  to contain this ugly monster so it does not spread and destroy our  country.
